intro: Alsine muscosa, commonly known as hairy alsike, is a low-growing annual plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters and has hairy, often succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, usually from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and covered in fine, soft hairs. Alsine muscosa is often found in moist soils along roadsides, meadows, and disturbed areas.
